plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub known for its large, showy flowers with a prominent central staminal column. Commonly found in warm climates and used ornamentally in gardens and landscapes.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, July included
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and used in teas and culinary dishes in many cultures.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial wildflower native to western North America, producing tall spikes of pea-like flowers that attract pollinators.
plants.funFact: Lupines fix nitrogen in the soil, improving soil fertility naturally.

plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A hardy perennial wildflower with large daisy-like purple flowers and a spiny central cone, popular in gardens and known for medicinal properties.
plants.funFact: Echinacea is widely used in herbal remedies believed to boost the immune system.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub that blooms profusely during summer with clusters of fragrant flowers, often used in warm climate ornamental gardening.
plants.location: Mediterranean, subtropical and tropical areas worldwide
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested; all parts of the plant contain poisonous compounds.
